hero.headline: YouTube Shorts Strategy 2025
hero.subheadline: Master short-form. Grow faster with vertical content.

sections.content: YouTube Shorts has evolved from experiment to essential. With billions of daily views, Shorts offers massive discovery potential. But Shorts strategy differs from long-form—different hooks, different pacing, different goals. Here's how to make Shorts work for your channel.

sections.title: Creating Effective Shorts
content: End with loop or strong CTA

sections.title: Shorts Best Practices
content: Hook in first second—or they swipe
Text on screen for silent viewing
Some Shorts just won't hit—that's normal
Shorts viewers can become long-form fans
Don't neglect long-form for Shorts only

faq.question: Do Shorts hurt long-form performance?
faq.answer: Generally no—they're separate audiences initially. Shorts can introduce new viewers to your channel. Some may convert to long-form subscribers. Key is quality in both formats. Don't sacrifice long-form for Shorts.

faq.question: How often should I post Shorts?
faq.answer: More is generally better for testing. Daily posting common for serious growth. Quality still matters—but Shorts forgive imperfection. 3-5 per week minimum for consistent presence. Test volume and see what's sustainable.

faq.question: Can I monetize Shorts?
faq.answer: Yes—Shorts Fund replaced by RPM monetization. Ad revenue now shared on Shorts. Lower per-view than long-form but volume compensates. Need to be in YPP. Monetization based on views in Shorts feed.

faq.question: Repurpose or create native Shorts?
faq.answer: Both work. Repurposing is efficient—clip best moments from long-form. Native Shorts can be more optimized for format. Many successful channels do both. Test what your audience responds to.
